alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:21AM EST until February 20 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... White River, Eagle Creek, and Eel River. .Melted snowpack combined with rainfall amounts of one to over two inches from Wednesday evening through today falling on frozen ground has caused significant runoff which will produce flooding along area rivers. Along the main stem rivers, flooding could be lengthened and possibly worsened by another storm system next week. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Noblesville. * WHEN...From this evening to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in both Riverbend and White River campgrounds. High water affects two businesses near SR 19 on the west side of Noblesville. Roads in residential areas of Riverwood, Clare, and Strawtown begin to flood. Flooding of roads begins in residential areas of Trails End near E 116th Street, near East 146th Street, and in gravel pit areas along the White River from East 96th Street north to Noblesville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 17.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued later today.
